hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Crush in Memecoins
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a >15% price spike in a memecoin (PEPE, DOGE) on high volume (>5x 24H average) driven by identifiable news/social media hype, a short position entered after the initial 1-hour candle close will be profitable as volatility compresses, with a 5% profit target and a 7% stop loss.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Memecoins are highly driven by sentiment and lack fundamental anchors. Sharp, news-driven spikes often exhaust buying interest rapidly ('buy the rumor, sell the news'). Retail traders who FOMO in provide immediate sell-side liquidity on any pullback, leading to a fast mean reversion of the initial exaggerated move.
entry_conditions: Identifiable news catalyst or social media trend (e.g., major influencer tweet, exchange listing rumor)
Entry is at the close of the first 1H candle after the spike that fails to make a new high

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price declines by 5% from entry price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price increases by 7% from entry price (new high)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The initial spike is the start of a sustained uptrend in >35% of cases, causing the stop loss to be hit before mean reversion occurs.
